p: Cimicifuga racemosa (L.) Nutt., Melia azedarach L., Coptis chinensis Franch., Phellodendron chinense C.K.Schneid., and Sophora tonkinensis var. polyphylla X.C.Huang & Z.C.Zhou decreased mouse hepatitis virus A59 (MHV-A59) production and intracellular viral RNA and protein expression with EC 50 values ranging from 2 to 27.5 μg/ml (Kim et al. 2008). Cimicifuga racemosa, M. azedarach, C. chinensis, P. chinense, and S. tonkinensis were good candidates for the treatment of coronaviral infections in both humans and animals (Kim et al. 2008). The underlying antiviral mechanism was most likely due to the inhibition of RNA-dependent RNA polymerase or proteases that are crucial for coronavirus RNA replication. Melia azedarach and C. chinensis may also affect virus assembly or release.
